channels.summary: Light discussion around personal SEO tooling and upcoming parasite SEO experiments, plus some casual chat.

highlights.title: SEO Freelancer Notion Dashboard
highlights.details: ph1l created a custom Notion dashboard to manage SEO freelance work and expressed satisfaction with the setup, implying a potentially shareable workflow/template for other SEO freelancers.

highlights.title: Planned 'game changing' parasite SEO approach
highlights.details: Mateusz Kielbasa teased an almost-ready 'game changing' parasite SEO method, suggesting upcoming experimentation or release of a new tactic in parasite SEO.

channels.summary: Ongoing discussion about AI search/GEO visibility strategies, including a research-based playbook, tooling (Spotlight), and debate on how GEO relates to traditional SEO and innovation risk.

highlights.title: GEO/AI visibility playbook and Spotlight automation
highlights.details: Michael announced a proven playbook for taking brands from 0% to 20% visibility in AI answers within two weeks, based on analysis of millions of prompt responses across 1000+ brands. He will share how to execute it using free tools and how the Spotlight platform can automate the process, with signups via Google Forms.

highlights.title: Grounding pages for LLM and AI chat visibility
highlights.details: ph1l raised concerns about unproven GEO tactics and pointed to 'grounding pages' as a currently working, validated approach in the industry to influence AI chat responses. He framed this as still falling under SEO, even when optimizing for AI chat-style search engines.

highlights.title: Debate on separating GEO from SEO and innovating with unproven tactics
highlights.details: Alan argued that GEO should not be separated from SEO and defended experimenting with unproven methods as core to innovation, acknowledging that some bets will fail and others will succeed.

channels.summary: Single self-introduction from an ads specialist; no substantive AI or tooling discussion.
